Key Arguments: The bill is an overreach by the Australian Government into the right to free speech.
The bill contradicts Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which guarantees freedom of opinion and expression.
The bill is likened to oppressive measures seen in countries like North Korea or China.
The bill is described as tyrannical, oppressive, and undemocratic.
The government should encourage open and honest public discussions instead of silencing dissent.
Notable Quotes: "I consider this bill to be a complete overreach by the Australian Government into my right to Free Speech."
"This Tyrannical attitude and treatment of the Australian people should never be allowed to enter into our lives, it is oppressive and undemocratic."
"The question that needs to asked is 'what are they (the government) afraid of, why do they want to stop the Australian public from questioning them'."
